data.title: How did ancient Greeks fight cavalry without horses themselves (like Indian kingdoms)?
data.meta_description: Answer (1 of 3): You don’t really need cavalry to beat cavalry, especially the relatively light cavalry of the classical era. In many cases terrain will do just fight to beat cavalry. Greeks didn’t need cavalry to hold off the Persians at Thermopylae. In fact the Persians couldn’t even use cavalr...
